meanings.definition: Leading or drawing towards a central point.
meanings.sent1: The adducent roads all converged at the town square.
meanings.sent2: The adducent lines on the map pointed towards the city center.
meanings.sent3: The adducent paths in the maze made it easy to find the treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her adducent gaze drew everyone's attention to the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The adducent force of the magnet pulled the metal objects closer together.

meanings.definition: A muscle that draws a part towards the median line of the body.
meanings.sent1: The adducent in his arm helped him lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: The adducent in her leg contracted to bring her foot back to the center.
meanings.sent3: The adducent in the athlete's back flexed as he prepared to jump.
meanings.sent4: The adducent in the dancer's neck tensed as she gracefully moved her head.
meanings.sent5: The adducent in the singer's throat tightened as she hit the high note.
